info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 6 at 4:45PM MST until September 6 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of South Central and Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, in South Central Arizona, southeastern Pima. In Southeast Arizona, western Cochise and northeastern Santa Cruz.
* WHEN...Until 745 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to a band of thunderstorms stretching from I-19 in Santa Cruz County to near Kartchner Caverns State Park in Cochise County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rio Rico, Whetstone, Sonoita, Elgin, Patagonia Lake State Park, Kartchner Caverns State Park and Madera Canyon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MST THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Cochise, AZ; Pima, AZ; Santa Cruz, AZ
